api/IniParser.Model.Configuration.IniPar.title: Class IniParserConfiguration | ini-parser
api/IniParser.Model.Configuration.IniPar.keywords: Class IniParserConfiguration Defines data for a Parser configuration object. Inheritance Object IniParserConfiguration ConcatenateDuplicatedKeysIniParserConfiguration Implements ICloneable Inherited Members Object.ToString() Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Namespace : IniParser.Model.Configuration Assembly : INIFileParser.dll Syntax public class IniParserConfiguration : ICloneable Constructors | Improve this Doc View Source IniParserConfiguration() Default values used if an instance of IniDataParser is created without specifying a configuration. Declaration public IniParserConfiguration() Remarks By default the various delimiters for the data are setted: ';' for one-line comments '[' ']' for delimiting a section '=' for linking key / value pairs An example of well formed data with the default values: ;section comment [section] ; section comment ; key comment key = value ;key comment ;key2 comment key2 = value | Improve this Doc View Source IniParserConfiguration(IniParserConfiguration) Copy ctor. Declaration public IniParserConfiguration(IniParserConfiguration ori) Parameters Type Name Description IniParserConfiguration ori Original instance to be copied. Fields | Improve this Doc View Source _strCommentRegex Declaration protected const string _strCommentRegex = "^{0}(.*)" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strKeyRegex Declaration protected const string _strKeyRegex = "^(\\s*[_\\.\\d\\w]*\\s*)" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strSectionRegexEnd Declaration protected const string _strSectionRegexEnd = "(\\s*?)$" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strSectionRegexMiddle Declaration protected const string _strSectionRegexMiddle = "{1}\\s*[\\p{L}\\p{P}\\p{M}_\\\"\\'\\{\\}\\#\\+\\;\\*\\%\\(\\)\\=\\?\\&\\$\\,\\:\\/\\.\\-\\w\\d\\s\\\\\\~]+\\s*" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strSectionRegexStart Declaration protected const string _strSectionRegexStart = "^(\\s*?)" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strSpecialRegexChars Declaration protected const string _strSpecialRegexChars = "[]\\^$.|?*+()" Field Value Type Description String | Improve this Doc View Source _strValueRegex Declaration protected const string _strValueRegex = "([\\s\\d\\w\\W\\.]*)$" Field Value Type Description String Properties | Improve this Doc View Source AllowCreateSectionsOnFly If set to false , the IniDataParser stop with a error if you try to access a section that was not created previously and the parser will stop with an error. If set to true , inexistents sections are created, always returning a valid SectionData element. Declaration public bool AllowCreateSectionsOnFly { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to false . | Improve this Doc View Source AllowDuplicateKeys If set to false and the IniDataParser finds duplicate keys in a section the parser will stop with an error. If set to true , duplicated keys are allowed in the file. The value of the duplicate key will be the last value asigned to the key in the file. Declaration public bool AllowDuplicateKeys { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to false . | Improve this Doc View Source AllowDuplicateSections If set to false and the IniDataParser finds a duplicate section the parser will stop with an error. If set to true , duplicated sections are allowed in the file, but only a SectionData element will be created in the Sections collection. Declaration public bool AllowDuplicateSections { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to false . | Improve this Doc View Source AllowKeysWithoutSection Allows having keys in the file that don't belong to any section. i.e. allows defining keys before defining a section. If set to false and keys without a section are defined, the IniDataParser will stop with an error. Declaration public bool AllowKeysWithoutSection { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to true . | Improve this Doc View Source AssigmentSpacer Sets the string around KeyValuesAssignmentChar Declaration public string AssigmentSpacer { get; set; } Property Value Type Description String Remarks Defaults to string ' ' | Improve this Doc View Source CaseInsensitive Retrieving section / keys by name is done with a case-insensitive search. Declaration public bool CaseInsensitive { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to false (case sensitive search) | Improve this Doc View Source CommentChar Sets the char that defines the start of a comment. A comment spans from the comment character to the end of the line. Declaration [Obsolete("Please use the CommentString property")] public char CommentChar { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Char Remarks Defaults to character ';' | Improve this Doc View Source CommentRegex Declaration public Regex CommentRegex { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Regex | Improve this Doc View Source CommentString Sets the string that defines the start of a comment. A comment spans from the mirst matching comment string to the end of the line. Declaration public string CommentString { get; set; } Property Value Type Description String Remarks Defaults to string ";" | Improve this Doc View Source ConcatenateDuplicateKeys Gets or sets a value indicating whether duplicate keys are concatenate together by . Declaration public bool ConcatenateDuplicateKeys { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Defaults to false . | Improve this Doc View Source KeyValueAssigmentChar Sets the char that defines a value assigned to a key Declaration public char KeyValueAssigmentChar { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Char Remarks Defaults to character '=' | Improve this Doc View Source NewLineStr Gets or sets the string to use as new line string when formating an IniData structure using a IIniDataFormatter. Parsing an ini-file accepts any new line character (Unix/windows) Declaration public string NewLineStr { get; set; } Property Value Type Description String Defaults to value Environment.NewLine Remarks This allows to write a file with unix new line characters on windows (and vice versa) | Improve this Doc View Source OverrideDuplicateKeys Only used if AllowDuplicateKeys is also true If set to true when the parser finds a duplicate key, it overrites the previous value, so the key will always contain the value of the last key readed in the file If set to false the first readed value is preserved, so the key will always contain the value of the first key readed in the file Declaration public bool OverrideDuplicateKeys { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to false . | Improve this Doc View Source SectionEndChar Sets the char that defines the end of a section name. If false the parser will just stop execution and return a null value. Declaration public bool ThrowExceptionsOnError { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean Remarks Defaults to true . api/IniParser.Model.html.title: Namespace IniParser.Model | ini-parser
api/IniParser.Model.html.keywords: Namespace IniParser.Model Classes IniData Represents all data from an INI file IniDataCaseInsensitive Represents all data from an INI file exactly as the IniData class, but searching for sections and keys names is done with a case insensitive search. KeyData Information associated to a key from an INI file. Includes both the value and the comments associated to the key. KeyDataCollection Represents a collection of Keydata. SectionData Information associated to a section in a INI File Includes both the value and the comments associated to the key. SectionDataCollection Represents a collection of SectionData.

If key contains no separator, it is treated as a key in the Global section. Key may contain no more than one separator character. String value If true is returned, is set to the value retrieved. index.html.title: This is the HOMEPAGE. | ini-parser
index.html.keywords: This is the HOMEPAGE . Refer to Markdown for how to write markdown files. Quick Start Notes: Add images to the images folder if the file is referencing an image.
